instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
It seems as though the 2850 is notorious for <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> issues as its a Poly Tant Cap. I was wondering, I have a number of donor boards (different numbers), but all the 330UF caps seem to be Poly Tant.  Are there boards with better versions or should I just buy a CERM 330uf from digikey or something?  Also does it matter if its a 2.5v cap? just as long as its 330UF?

PS. Symptoms are that it intermittently shuts down and gets really hot really fast around the CPU.  Shutdown/reset seems to happen frequently after "waking", but also during use of Safari. Its fully functional otherwise, and has no signs of drop or liquid. Figured I would do a plz bro repair with the cap since they are so common with these.

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: You need to match the voltage rating on the original caps... A ceramic would work IF you could get it to fit.

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I can see that being an issue if its under, but it would only be .5 over the orig. What are people using as direct replacements then?

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Just use the standard size 330uF and not the small ones.

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: As long as its over the voltage rating and not under its fine

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: As in replace with another polytant?

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: What about the rest of my question?

threads.title: Poly Tant <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Poly tant isnt the issue. It is the small form factor and bad batch of caps that is.
